Cristián Alvear.title: variaciones sobre las instrucciones
Cristián Alvear.about:
Alvear, Bondi & d'incise consists of Cristián Alvear from Chile, and Cyril Bondi and d'incise from Switzerland. The three musicians collaborate frequently in duo and trio formats.



This album documents a duo performance by Alvear (guitar) and d’incise (vibraphone, electronics) of “Sleepless Night” (2022), a work by Spanish composer/sound artist Clara de Asís; and a trio performance by Alvear (guitar), Bondi (vibraphone) and d’incise (electronics) of “uno, dos o tres en una pieza para cuatro” (2016), by the Chilean composer Santiago Astaburuaga. Recorded in May 2023, both performances effectively weave together the straightforward sounds of guitar, vibraphone and electronics, resulting in works of indescribable beauty.
Cristián Alvear.credits:
released March 1, 2024
            
            released January 28, 2024

Recorded at insub.studio by d'incise, May 2023

Artwork by d'incise

Design by Cathy Fishman

This is the third installment in a series of three albums, which are part of a project by the duo Alvear / Bondi. It consists in the interpretation and recording of six new compositions commissioned by the duo to three Chilean and three Swiss artists (Mara Winter, Bárbara González, Anna-Kaisa Meklin , Santiago Astaburuaga, Nicolás Carrasco & d'incise). The project was made possible with the support of the Swiss Arts Council Pro Helvetia South America and Fondation SUISA.



Recorded at Insub.studio in Geneva and Alvear’s home studio in Santiago de Chile between November and December, 2021 - Mixed and mastered by Cristián Alvear - Cover by d'incise.

Cristián Alvear.title: Taku Sugimoto: solo for guitar 1 (2014-2015)
Cristián Alvear.about: Shaping the form of Sugimoto's Solo For Guitar 1 consisted on the elaboration of its contour and structure (its exterior and interior configuration). This was possible by applying James Tenney's analytical methodology as was presented in his master's degree thesis Meta + Hodos in 1961. Therefore, each sound configuration, whether as unit in a sequence or as a configuration of sequences deployed as overlapped layers, were devised using both the clang/sequence concept and the graphical representation of its parametric profile.
Cristián Alvear.credits:

Cristián Alvear.title: Telquan
Cristián Alvear.about: Cristián Alvear and Tim Olive first played together in October 2016, doing three concerts in Japan. Alvear returned to Japan in October of 2017, and they performed together again, in Kyoto and Osaka, then spent a day recording in Kobe. This single improvised piece is the result of that day. The music is heard as it was recorded, with a few structural edits.
Cristián Alvear.credits:
released September 1, 2019
            
            Cristián Alvear: guitar 

Tim Olive: magnetic pickups 

Recorded in Kobe, October 2017

Limited Edition of 100 

Edited & mixed by Cristián Alvear 

Mastered by Alan Jones

Cristián Alvear.title: Bow down thine ear, I bring you glad tidings
Cristián Alvear.about:
Among the musicians whose work closely reflects the reduced forms in experimental music, perhaps the most interesting is Cristián Alvear, a Chilean guitarist performing formally radical post-Cagean music, as well as Laurent Peter aka d'incise, a composer, multi-instrumentalist and producer, one of the key figures of the eclectic scene in Geneva. The numerous projects in which they participate prove their strictly defined artistic vision and active involvement in networking the music community, so it’s appropriate to consider them as transitory elements between several scenes on different continents. They have collaborated, among others, with Ryoko Akama, Cyril Bondi, Michael Pisaro, Sarah Hennies, Seijiro Murayama, Taku Sugimoto, Lance Austin Olsen and The Pitch. 



Bow Down Thine Ear, I Bring You Glad Tidings is a good example of the refinement of the style developed by Alvear and d’incise in recent years. One can observe here how their musical language and range of instrumental techniques in the use of guitar and idiophones got crystallised. 



The classical form of a musical piece organized in time and characterized by a set of elements that create a coherent narrative is replaced here by the primacy of repetition, pitch, precise articulation and reverberation. Sounds seem to be clearly rooted in specific acoustic spaces, which allows the space itself to be treated as a real instrument that adds another layer of meaning. Repetitive sound sequences operate in a similar way to the metronome, determining an obsessive rhythmic pattern, a kind of matrix on which all the details are inscribed. The static structure of the pieces allows the music to function as a sound sculpture - breaking time constraints in favour of continuous duration and acting in a multi-perspective way. This material, does not promise any solution, but strictly accompanies the listener and tries to close itself in the continuous present. 



At the same time Bow Down Thine Ear, I Bring You Glad Tidings is a clear dialogue with the work of Henry Purcell. The title of the album is a reference to the anthems written by the British composer (Z11, Z2) and the titles of the pieces refer to his sacred songs (Z192, Z342). Apart from a skillful attempt to decontextualize the lyrics (biblical or rooted in the tradition of baroque religious poetry), we can see here not so much an attempt to give the music a metaphysical character, but certainly Alvear and d’incise tend to replicate a similar mode of listening, as in the case of Purcell's compositions - meditative and at the same time oriented to all elements of the musical situation.
Cristián Alvear.credits:
released September 5, 2020
            
            Cristián Alvear: guitar

Cristián Alvear.title: Pieza Para Guitarra Afinada
Cristián Alvear.about:
PT37

Cristián Alvear - Pieza Para Guitarra Afinada

Cassette edition of 80 

pilgrimtalk.com/PT37.html



 Pieza Para Guitarra Afinada 

(Piece For Tuned Guitar)

for Nick Hoffman and Taku Sugimoto



Recorded at Estudios Madre Selva, Santiago de Chile, April 2018

Composed by Cristián Alvear



Making direct reference to Erik Satie’s enigmatic Vexations, Pieza Para Guitarra Afinada (Piece For Tuned Guitar), by guitarist Cristián Alvear, is a highly focused exploration of repetition and extreme duration. Utilizing small melodic cells and nontraditional tuning, Alvear crafts a hypnotic, wave-like structure that seems to subtly bend or even suspend the perception of linear time.

Cristián Alvear.title: Ocho pretextos
Cristián Alvear.about:
Cristián Alvear: guitar

Cyril Bondi: percussions

d'incise: electronics



This chilean-swiss trio is adept of a delicate minimalism, drawing colors, tones, and sometimes even a few seconds of melodies, from folk sources.

An experimental inspiration and reinterpretation stretched to the extreme, a ghostly, strange, peaceful and acoustic evocation. Collaborating since 2014, the group composed this new serie of short pieces during two residencies in Osorno and Geneva during the spring 2019. Cristián Alvear is an eminent figure of the chilean scene, having play many composers such as Micheal Pisaro, Catherine Lamb, Jurg Frey, etc, gaining a strong international respect. Cyril Bondi and d'incise, minds behind the Insub.label and orchestra, are tireless and radical explorers of the experimental field, building a web of collaborations since 15 years. Composed by the trio during two residencies (january 2019 at Centro Cultural Sofia Hott, Osorno, Chile & may 2019, Insub.studio, Geneva, Switzerland) with the support of COINCIDENCIA - Cultural Exchanges [Pro Helvetia].



Recorded and mixed at Insub.studio by d'incise

Cristián Alvear.title: pequeños fragmentos de una música discreta
Cristián Alvear.about: Music as a testimony of its context, of its emergency conditions, of the elements that constitute it. Sound materiality that is the memory of those who instantiate it, of those who perform it, of the threads of its forming weave (including those extra-musical threads). Music like photography, which preserves the discrete minute (a sound that, finally, only survives in memory), the sound trace of a traced furrow, an experience imprint (erfharung) on the sound object.
Cristián Alvear.credits:
released July 5, 2020

Cristián Alvear.title: interior/exterior (2019)
Cristián Alvear.about:
interior/exterior es el segundo trabajo discográfico del dúo Alvear/Astaburuaga. La obra registrada en este disco, compuesta por ambos durante el año 2018, está conformada por una serie de piezas escritas que fueron realizadas en diferentes locaciones de las ciudades de Valdivia, de Osorno y de Valparaíso: un jardín botánico, un gallinero abandonado, un bosque húmedo, una transitada catedral, unas escaleras en un cerro, una sanguchería de paso y un muelle de una ciudad-puerto, un cementerio junto a una cárcel y una cascada empujada por un caudaloso río.



La instrumentación utilizada y los medios de registro empleados en el proceso de realización hacen las veces de base para la exploración de cada sitio, lo cual, necesariamente, requirió, en tanto criterio de interpretación, la transportabilidad. Fuera de la lógica del contexto mudo del estudio de grabación, Alvear y Astaburuaga decidieron moverse de un lugar a otro para interpretar y grabar -mediante una técnica de captación estéreo sencilla- una colección de piezas que buscan urdir, con cada iteración, los elementos propios de toda escena de producción de con la música realizada.



Cristián Alvear & Santiago Astaburuaga, dispositivos.

Cristián Alvear, grabación.

Santiago Astaburuaga, fotografía.

Alan Jones, masterización.

Mathieu Ruhlmann, diseño.



Publicado en el 15 de marzo de 2020

Cristián Alvear.title: Lo Wie: Cloud scissors/4 performers
Cristián Alvear.artist: Cristián Alvear, Santiago Astaburuaga, Gudinni Cortina y Rolando Hernández
Cristián Alvear.about:
En noviembre de 2015 nos juntamos en Valdivia, Chile para estrenar la obra Cloud Scissors / 4 performers de Lo Wie en el último día Festival Relincha.



Durante dos días,discutimos los parámetros y acciones que utilizariamos para actualizar la pieza que amablemente Lo Wie envío a Cristián desde Seúl a Santiago para poder tener las partituras originales, pues a ella le interesa la interacción de los ejecutantes con la materialidad del obra.



Los resultados de la obra fueron sonidos y acciones (a veces silentes) en donde se busca crear distintas atenciones y situaciones para la escucha ; así como sonidos ambientales, que se vuelven parte de la pieza.



(¿Acaso hay diferencia entre pieza y ambiente en la escucha?)



En este documento podemos escuchar los resultados sonoros de dicha actualización.

Lo cual significa que lo que escucharán será un residuo de lo que ya fue.

Cristián Alvear.about:
DIATRIBES & CRISTI¡N ALVEAR

Roshambo (trio)



released in November 2015





Diatribes:

Cyril Bondi, percussions, objects

Díincise, laptop

with Cristián Alvear, guitar



Roshambo (trio)

(composed by Diatribes)





This new version of diatribes's piece "Roshambo" (previously released in duo version on the "A new castle" album) was recorded in Santiago, Chile in December 2014, during diatribes tour in South America.



It consist of an ongoing recombination of a limited amount of subtle and soft sound textures, like a serie of slow breathes, taking a new instrumental color with Cristian's guitar, a more electronic aspect due to d'incise choice of sounds and field recording fragments, along Cyril's delicate touch on acoustic objects.



Recorded in Santiago, Chile, 11.12.2014 at Madre Selva studio, by Alfonso Pérez.



Mix, master and artwork by d'incise.

Cristián Alvear.title: A távlat, ha hátulról
Cristián Alvear.artist: Cristián Alvear, Alan Courtis & Alan Jones
Cristián Alvear.about:
Recorded at Estudios MadreSelva in Santiago, Chile by Alfonso Pérez 



A távlat, ha hátulról began as a transandine acoustic drone collaboration, limited to tones and/or the acoustic and physical properties from classical guitars. 



Rather than simply recording a wide variety of sounds, rules were implemented, such as procedurally generating sine tones, projected into and through the bodies of the guitars. By exciting the guitar strings with tones that match specific frequencies, partials revealed themselves, sending Alvear and Courtis down new sonic paths to explore. This procedure resulted in full-colored, rich, and natural timbral outputs of the guitars themselves: in addition to resonances throughout the instruments' cavities, all of the sounds arise from sympathetic frequencies on strings and fretboards. The material was then given to Jones, composer ex post facto, using test equipment for spectral analysis of the sound, assembling the work into both colorful and atonal sequences, approaching the process as one might in a laboratory, ultimately layering, sequencing, and presenting the work as his own.
Cristián Alvear.credits:
released December 13, 2017
            
            released December 13, 2017

Cristián Alvear.title: Alvin Lucier: On the carpet of leaves illuminated by the moon (Live Recording)
Cristián Alvear.about:
Live recording

The title of the work is taken from Italo Calvino’s novel “If on a winter’s night a traveler.” On page 199 one reads:
“The gingko leaves fell like rain from the boughs and dotted the lawn with yellow. I was walking with Mr. Okeda on the path of smooth stones. I said I would like to distinguish the sensation of each single gingko leaf from the sensation of all others, but I was wondering if it would be possible... If from the gingko tree a single yellow leaf falls and rests on the lawn, the sensation felt in looking at it is that of a single yellow leaf. If two leaves descend from the tree, the eye follows the twirling of the two leaves as they move closer, then separate in the air, like two butterflies chasing each other, then glide finally to the grass, one here, one there... I would like to maintain distinct, not confusing it with the others, the individual image of each leaf... and follow it in its aerial dance until it comes to rest on the blades of grass. I began to concentrate my attention on capturing the tiniest sensations at the moment of their delineation. when the clarity was not yet mingled with a sheaf of diffuse impressions.”
“On the carpet of leaves illuminated by the moon” was written for Ryuko Mizutani. The version for cello was written for Michael Moser. The version for acoustic guitar was written with the assistance of Elliot Simpson.

Cristián Alvear.about: Ramas es una obra mixta para guitarra y electroacústica inspirada en los procesos de germinación y crecimiento de las plantas. La propuesta central considera la noción de expansión respecto de las posibilidades tímbricas y expresivas del instrumento mediante el uso de técnicas tradicionales y extendidas en interacción con sonidos electroacústicos y silencios, con el fin de otorgar una nueva dimensión gestual, temporal y dramática a la obra.
Cristián Alvear.credits:
released March 25, 2013
                        
                    
                

                Recording: Alfonso Pérez on March in Santiago, Chile. 

Editing/Mastering: Alfonso Pérez at Estudios Madreselva 

Guitar: Cristián Alvear Montecino  

www.cristianalvear.com
